Resistance from residents: Some residents may be resistant to the idea of recycling and may not see the value in it, which could make it difficult to get people to participate in the program.
Lack of awareness: Without proper education and awareness campaigns, some residents may not be aware of the benefits of recycling or how to properly sort and dispose of their waste.
Inadequate infrastructure: The city may not have the necessary infrastructure in place to effectively collect and process recyclable materials, such as recycling bins and processing facilities.
Limited resources: The city may not have the necessary resources, such as personnel and equipment, to effectively collect and process recyclable materials.
Political barriers: There may be political barriers to implementing a city-wide recycling initiative, such as opposition from city council members or other stakeholders.
